thread.title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan believes world record signing Paul Pogba will begin to show his true potential at Manchester United
thread.title_full: Henrikh Mkhitaryan believes world record signing Paul Pogba will begin to show his true potential at Manchester United

author: sunsportonline
title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan believes world record signing Paul Pogba will begin to show his true potential at Manchester United
text:
EFL Pog's top dog Henrikh Mkhitaryan believes world record signing Paul Pogba will begin to show his true potential at Manchester United 
The 23-year-old has struggled for consistency since re-joining the Red Devils for £89million from Juventus in the summer by tony little HENRIKH MKHITARYAN is convinced Paul Pogba will soon be living up to his world-record price tag. 
Manchester United paid Juventus a jaw-dropping £89million for the France star last summer. Getty Images The duo both joined Manchester United in the summer from Juventus and Borussia Dortmund seperately Getty Images Pogba has shown flashes of brilliance including this stunner against Swansea City 
Pogba ’s performances so far have been up and down – a bit like United themselves. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But Mkhitaryan , who also made a slow start to his Old Trafford career, said: “Maybe people are waiting for something extraordinary from him, some miracles. 
“But everyone has to know he’s a football player, a human being, so he just has to play the way he can play and he will do better. Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Leicester v Man Utd Getty Images An EFL Cup final against Southampton at Wembley could be the duo's first piece of silverware with the club Related stories Watford 2 Burnley 1: Headers from Troy Deeney and M'Baye Niang sink ten-man Clarets Bench for the Bridge? Sergio Aguero emerges as surprise target for Chelsea as doubts surround Manchester City role GIFT OF THE GAB Gabriel Jesus says he joined Man City over rivals like Barca as Pep Guardiola was only boss to call him Conte salutes blues Chelsea boss Antonio Conte hails valiant Blues after outclassing Arsenal in title race No risk taken Hector Bellerin 'did not know score' after taking elbow to the face in first Prem game at Stamford Bridge since Ryan Mason fractured skull IGGY BANK Odion Ighalo says he wanted to stay in Prem.. but had to settle for £190k a week in China with Changchun Yatai Hughes POINTS FINGER Mark Hughes hints West Brom intentionally leaked Saido Berahino's drug ban before Stoke clash CLUELESS Jurgen Klopp has questioned the mental attitude of his Liverpool squad after they lost to Hull City 2-0 on Saturday EMIRATES CALLING Michael Carrick is a shock transfer target for Arsene Wenger who is looking to bolster his midfield SPENT FORCE Jose Mourinho aims cheeky jibe at Pep Guardiola - claiming he cannot buy the title in England pitch perfect Martin Olsson rapped for Swansea pals... and says Paul Clement has everyone singing from same hymn-sheet thierry henry Gabriel Jesus is the latest top-notch No9 import to set European academy alarm bells rings Reuters 4 He scored a vital away goal in the 2-1 loss at the KCOM Stadium against Hull City 
“He needs a little bit more time to adapt because it’s not very easy to be worth £89million. 
“He is still 23 years old and maybe he is thinking he needs to do more than he’s doing but I know with the manager he is going to find the solution to solve it.” 
The French international has chipped in with seven goals in all competitions this season, and can look forward to an EFL Cup final at Wembley against Southampton. Paul Pogba and Jesse Lingard practice new celebration dance in the changing room 
Since making his international debut with France in 2013, he has gone on to make 44 caps, and has found the back of the net on eight occasions. 
In four seasons with the Italian giants, he won four consecutive Serie A title's, as well as picking up two Coppa Italia winners medal's.
